00001 sub _LiveGraphics3D_init {}; # don't reload this file
00002 
00003 =head2 LiveGraphics3D.pl
00004 
00005  ###########################################################################
00006  #
00007  #   Macros for handling interactive 3D graphics via the LiveGraphics3D
00008  #   Java applet.  The applet needs to be in the course html directory.
00009  #   (If it is in the system html area, you will need to change the
00010  #   default below or supply the jar option explicitly).
00011  #
00012  #   The LiveGraphics3D applet displays a mathematica Graphics3D object
00013  #   that is stored in a .m file (or a compressed one).  Use Mathematica
00014  #   to create one.  (In the future, I plan to write a perl class that
00015  #   will create these for you on the fly. -- DPVC)
00016  #
00017  #   The main routines are
00018  #
00019  #      Live3Dfile          load a data file
00020  #      Live3Ddata          load raw Graphics3D data
00021  #      LiveGraphics3D      access to all parameters
00022  #
00023  
00024  #
00025  #  LiveGraphics3D(options)
00026  #
00027  #  Options are from:
00028  #
00029  #     file => name           name of .m file to load
00030  #
00031  #     archive => name        name of a .zip file to load
00032  #
00033  #     input => 3Ddata        string containing Graphics3D data to
00034  #                            be displayed by the applet
00035  #
00036  #     size => [w,h]          width and height of applet
00037  #
00038  #     vars => [vars]         hash of variables to pass as independent
00039  #                            variables to the applet, togther with
00040  #                            their initial values
00041  #                              e.g., vars => [a=>1,b=>1]
00042  #
00043  #     depend => [list]       list of dependent variables to pass to
00044  #                            the applet with their replacement strings
00045  #                            (see LiveGraphics3D documentation)
00046  #
00047  #     jar => URL             where to find the live.jar file
00048  #
00049  #     background=>"#RRGGBB"  the background color to use (default is white)
00050  #
00051  #     scale => n             scaling factor for applet (default is 1.)
00052  #
00053  #     image => file          a file containing an image to use in TeX mode
00054  #                            or when Java is disabled
00055  #
00056  #     tex_size => ratio      a scaling factor for the TeX image (as a portion
00057  #                            of the line width).  
00058  #                                1000 is 100%, 500 is 50%, etc.
00059  #
00060  #     tex_center => 0 or 1   center the image in TeX mode or not
00061  #
00062  #     Live3D => [params]     hash of additional parameters to pass to
00063  #                            the Live3D applet.
00064  #                              e.g. Live3D => [VISIBLE_FACES => "FRONT"]
00065  #
00066 
00067 =cut
00068 
00069 
00070 sub LiveGraphics3D {
00071   my %options = (
00072     size => [250,250],
00073     jar => "live.jar", # "${htmlURL}live.jar",
00074     codebase => findAppletCodebase("live.jar"),
00075     # codebase => "http://hosted2.webwork.rochester.edu/webwork2_files/applets/",  # used for testing
00076     background => "#FFFFFF",
00077     scale => 1.,
00078     tex_size => 500,
00079     tex_cener => 0,
00080     @_
00081   );
00082   my $out = ""; my $p; my %pval;
00083   my $ratio = $options{tex_size} * (.001);
00084 
00085   if ($main::displayMode eq "TeX") {
00086     #
00087     #  In TeX mode, include the image, if there is one, or
00088     #   else give the user a message about using it on line
00089     #
00090     if ($options{image}) {
00091       $out = "\\includegraphics[width=$ratio\\linewidth]{$options{image}}";
00092       $out = "\\centerline{$out}" if $options{tex_center};
00093       $out .= "\n";
00094     } else {
00095       $out = "\\vbox{
00096          \\hbox{[ This image is created by}
00097          \\hbox{\\quad an interactive applet;}
00098          \\hbox{you must view it on line ]}
00099       }";
00100     }
00101   } else {
00102     my ($w,$h) = @{$options{size}};
00103     $out .= $bHTML if ($main::displayMode eq "Latex2HTML");
00104     #
00105     #  Put the applet in a table
00106     #
00107     $out .= qq{\n<TABLE BORDER="1" CELLSPACING="2" CELLPADDING="0">\n<TR>};
00108     $out .= qq{<TD WIDTH="$w" HEIGHT="$h" ALIGN="CENTER">};
00109     #
00110     #  start the applet
00111     #
00112     $out .= qq{
00113       <APPLET CODEBASE="$options{codebase}" ARCHIVE="$options{jar}" CODE="Live.class" WIDTH="$w" HEIGHT="$h">
00114       <PARAM NAME="BGCOLOR" VALUE="$options{background}">
00115       <PARAM NAME="MAGNIFICATION" VALUE="$options{scale}">
00116     };
00117     #
00118     #  include the file or data
00119     #
00120     $out .= qq{<PARAM NAME="INPUT_ARCHIVE" VALUE="$options{archive}">\n} 
00121       if ($options{archive});
00122     $out .= qq{<PARAM NAME="INPUT_FILE" VALUE="$options{file}">\n} 
00123       if ($options{file});
00124     $out .= qq{<PARAM NAME="INPUT" VALUE="$options{input}">\n} 
00125       if ($options{input});
00126     #
00127     #  include any independent variables
00128     #
00129     if ($options{vars}) {
00130       my @vars = (); %pval = @{$options{vars}};
00131       foreach $p (lex_sort(keys(%pval))) {push(@vars,"${p}->$pval{$p}");}
00132       $out .=
00133     '<PARAM NAME="INDEPENDENT_VARIABLES" VALUE="{'.join(',',@vars).'}">';
00134       $out .= "\n";
00135     }
00136     #
00137     #  include dependent variables
00138     #
00139     if ($options{depend}) {
00140       my @depend = (); $pval = @{$options{depend}};
00141       foreach $p (lex_sort(keys(%pval))) {push(@depend,"${p}->$pval{$p}");}
00142       $out .=
00143     '<PARAM NAME="DEPENDENT_VARIABLES" VALUE="{'.join(',',@depend).'}">';
00144       $out .= "\n";
00145     }
00146     #
00147     #  include any extra Live3D parameters
00148     #
00149     if ($options{Live3D}) {
00150       my %pval = @{$options{Live3D}};
00151       foreach $p (lex_sort(keys(%pval))) {
00152     $out .= qq{<PARAM NAME="$p" VALUE="$pval{$p}">\n};
00153       }
00154     }
00155     #
00156     #  End the applet and table
00157     #
00158     $out .= qq{<IMG SRC="$options{image}" BORDER="0">} if ($options{image});
00159     $out .= "<SMALL>[Enable Java to make this image interactive]</SMALL><BR>";
00160     $out .= "</APPLET>";
00161     $out .= "</TD></TD>\n</TABLE>\n";
00162     $out .= $eHTML if ($main::displayMode eq "Latex2HTML");
00163   }
00164 
00165   return $out;
00166 }
00167 
00168 #
00169 #  Syntactic sugar to make it easier to pass files and data to
00170 #  LiveGraphics3D.
00171 #
00172 sub Live3Dfile {
00173   my $file = shift;
00174   LiveGraphics3D(file => $file, @_);
00175 }
00176 
00177 #
00178 #  Syntactic sugar to make it easier to pass raw Graohics3D data
00179 #  to LiveGraphics3D.
00180 #
00181 sub Live3Ddata {
00182   my $data = shift;
00183   LiveGraphics3D(input => $data, @_);
00184 }
00185 
00186 
00187 #
00188 #  A message you can use for a caption under a graph
00189 #
00190 $LIVEMESSAGE = MODES(
00191   TeX => '',
00192   Latex2HTML =>
00193      $BCENTER.$BSMALL."Drag the surface to rotate it".$ESMALL.$ECENTER,
00194   HTML => $BCENTER.$BSMALL."Drag the surface to rotate it".$ESMALL.$ECENTER
00195 );
